title.narrative: FIELD OPERATIONS IN EMERGENCY

description.narrative: UNICEF Yemen Country Office (YCO) has an up-to-date emergency preparedness and response capacity, which contributes to Environmental Sustainability, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Government and other partners at central and governorate level are undertaking equity focused, and evidence informed planning, monitoring and evaluation.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF YCO has an up-to-date emergency preparedness and response capacity

description.narrative: UNICEF emergency preparedness procedures are in place and activated to ensure having life-saving interventions to affected population from conflict. Epidemic/Pandemic and natural disasters.; The year 2020 has proven to be as challenging due to overlapping covid19 pandemic, intensified armed conflict in various governorates and unprecedented heavy rains and floods causing additional humanitarian needs due to displacement, loss of survival means and coping mechanisms. CO was able to respond effectively using previous investment in preparedness work, including field office contingency plans and the rapid response mechanism (RRM). | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:17/01/2021
